member.name: Smt. Sushma Swaraj
member.content:
Sushma Swaraj, External Affairs Minister of India, was born on 14 February 1952 in Ambala, Haryana. She has been elected seven times as a Member of Parliament and three times as a Member of the Legislative Assembly. She is an Advocate by profession and educated at S.D.College, Ambala Cantt (Haryana) and Department of Laws, Panjab University, Chandigarh.

Political Career:
Mrs Sushma Swaraj began her political career with the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad in the 1970s. She became a member of the Haryana Legislative Assembly and a Cabinet Minister in Haryana at the age of 25 in 1977 and held 7 portfolios. She became State President of Janata Party (Haryana) in 1979, when she was 27. She was Education Minister, Haryana in the Bharatiya Janata Party-Lok Dal coalition government during 1987-90.

In April 1990, she was elected as a Member of the Rajya Sabha and remained there until she was elected to the 11th Lok Sabha from South Delhi constituency in 1996. She was Union Cabinet Minister for Information and Broadcasting in the first Atal Bihari Vajpayee Government in 1996. She was re-elected to 12th Lok Sabha from South Delhi Parliamentary constituency for a 2nd term in 1998. In the second Vajpayee Government, she was sworn in as Cabinet Minister for Information and Broadcasting with additional charge of the Ministry of Telecommunications from 19 March to 12 October 1998. She resigned from the Union Cabinet to take over as the first woman Chief Minister of Delhi in October 1998.

She resigned her Assembly seat to return to national politics and was Minister for Information & Broadcasting from September 30, 2000 to January 29, 2003 and Minister of Health & Family Welfare and Parliamentary Affairs from January 2003 until May 2004.

Mrs Swaraj was re-elected to the Rajya Sabha in April 2006 from Madhya Pradesh. She served as the Deputy Leader of BJP in Rajya Sabha till April 2009. She won the 2009 election to the 15th Lok Sabha from the Vidisha Lok Sabha constituency in Madhya Pradesh and became Leader of Opposition in the 15th Lok Sabha on 21 December 2009 and retained this position till May 2014. She has been re-elected to 16th Lok Sabha from Vidisha in 2014.

member.name: Dr. S. Jaishankar
member.content:
Dr. S. Jaishankar assumed his responsibilities as Foreign Secretary of India on 29 January 2015.Dr.Jaishankar has more than three decades of diplomatic experience. Joining the Indian Foreign Service in 1977, Dr. Jaishankar has represented India's interests and fostered friendly working relationships in countries around the world.

Dr. Jaishankar's first postings abroad were as Third and Second Secretary (Political) at the Embassy of India in Moscow from 1979 to 1981. From 1981 to 1985, he served as Under Secretary (Americas) and Policy Planning in the Ministry of External Affairs. He then spent three years from 1985 to 1988 as First Secretary handling political affairs at the Indian Embassy in Washington, DC, followed by two years as First Secretary and Political Advisor to the Indian Peace Keeping Force (IPKF) in Sri Lanka.

In 1990, Dr. Jaishankar became Commercial Counsellor in Budapest. After three years in that position, he returned to India where he served first as Director of East Europe Division of the Ministry of External Affairs, and then as Press Secretary for the President of India.

Following this service in India, Dr. Jaishankar went abroad again - to Tokyo in 1996 as Deputy Chief of Mission. In the year 2000, he was appointed the Ambassador of India to Czech Republic and served in Prague till 2004.

Upon completing his time as Ambassador in Prague, Dr. Jaishankar returned once again to India, where he led the Americas Division in the Ministry of External Affairs. After three years heading the division, he again left India in 2007 to serve as High Commissioner to Singapore for two years.

Dr. Jaishankar was the Ambassador of India to China from 2009 to 2013 and was the Ambassador of India to US before assuming responsibilities as Foreign Secretary. Dr. Jaishankar holds a PhD and M.Phil in International Relations and a M.A. in Political Science. He is a member of the International Institute for Strategic Studies in London.

Dr. Jaishankar is married to Kyoko Jaishankar and has two sons and a daughter.

member.name: Smt. Sindhushree Khullar
member.content:
Ms. Sindhushree Khullar joined the Indian Administrative Service in 1975. She has 40 years of administrative experience in various capacities in Government of India. She is the first CEO of NITI Aayog.

She holds Masters' degrees in Public Administration from the Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University (1991), Development Economics from Boston University (1985) and Sociology from Jawaharlal Nehru University (1974). She was also a Fellow at the Asian Institute of Management, Manila, Philippines between 1995-1999.

Prior to this, she was Secretary in the erstwhile Planning Commission, Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports, Special Secretary, Ministry of Finance (Department of Economic Affairs) and Chairperson, New Delhi Municipal Council, Government of National Capital Territory (NCT) of Delhi. As Secretary Youth Affairs and Sports, she successfully steered the prestigious 2010 Commonwealth Games held in Delhi.

member.name: Dr. B K Agnihotri
member.content:
Dr. Bhishma Kumar Agnihotri completed his studies in United States and received two advanced degrees in Law from University of California and New York University.

Currently, Dr Agnihotri is the President of Friends of India Society International, Inc., and the Chairman of the Bharat Swabhiman Overseas, Inc. He is also a senior counsel to a law firm and is admitted to various jurisdictions including the Supreme Court of the United States.

Prior to this, Dr Agnihotri was the Dean and Chancellor of the Southern University Law Center in Louisiana. He also served as Global Ambassador-at-Large, Government of India for NRI/PIOs. In addition he was also Ambassador rank Special Advisor accredited to the United Nations.

Dr Agnihotri has been involved as an advisor to many organizations in the USA. However his greatest contribution has been helping Association of American Physicians of India (AAPI) from its inception to its present strength. Furthermore, Dr Agnihotri conducts seminars each semester on Global Law and Practice, and International Trade Law to the future lawyers.

member.name: Shri Joginder Pal Sanger
member.content:
Mr. Joginder Pal Sanger is the Chairman and owner of Mastcraft Ltd. and Transatlantic Life Assurance Company, UK. Mastcraft Ltd. has a large portfolio of Commercial and Residential properties including hotels in The UK. Mr. Sanger's business interests in India include a large multi branch Travel Agency and a property portfolio.

For his commendable work, Mr. Sanger has received numerous awards including the Asian of the Year 2011 by BBC, The Asian Community Award at the House of Commons, UK and Lifetime Achievement Award (2006) at the Punjabi Pravasi Divas, Chandigarh.

Mr. Sanger is a prominent philanthropist and believes in promoting Indian culture and values abroad. He is the Chairman of the Bhartiya Vidya Bhawan, UK and India Forum, London. He is the patron of various Indian Associations and religious organisations in The UK.

member.name: Shri Yusuff Ali M.A.
member.designation: Managing Director, EMKE LuLu Group, UAE
member.content:
Mr. Yusuff Ali M.A is an Overseas Indian entrepreneur based in Dubai. He is the Managing Director of the Lulu Group.

Mr. Yusuff Ali is an elected Director Board Member of the Abu Dhabi Chamber of Commerce and Industry and holds other important positions including Vice Chairman of the Non-Resident Keralites Affairs Department (NORKA-ROOTS); Member Central Wakf Council, Government of India and the Director of both Cochin International Airport Ltd and Kannur International Airport Ltd.

Mr. Yusuff Ali is the first non-resident Indian from the Gulf and the West Asia to be conferred the prestigious Padmashri Award in 2008 for his contributions. He is closely involved with many social, charitable and humanitarian activities, both, in India as well as in Gulf countries and plays an important role in fostering the interests of NRI's.

For his work, he was awarded the Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Award (2005) by the Government of India and the Wessam Al Bahrain by the Government of Bahrain.

Currently, he is the Member of the Board of Trustees, India Development Foundation of Overseas Indians, Ministry of Overseas Indians, Government of India.

member.name: Smt. Ritu Beri
member.designation: MD, Ritu Beri Design Pvt. Ltd
member.content:
Ms. Ritu Beri's name is synonymous with the globalization of India's fashion industry. Ms. Beri was among the first Indian designers to be featured in international fashion shows with her label which fused Indian aesthetics with global fashion trends. She is the protege of the French embroidery maestro, Francois LeSage and added value to the styles she learned with her personal propriety and patent of intellectual and creative capital.

Over the years, Ms. Beri has won many prestigious fashion awards globally. Time magazine had declared her "The First lady of fashion in her country" after she became the first Asian to head a French fashion house, Jean Louis Scherrer. She was awarded the prestigious French honour, Chevaliere des art et des Lettres in 2010. A nominee for the Economic Times Business Woman of the year Award in India, she is noted to be amongst the 20 Best Dressed Celebrity Icons of the country, being voted "Delhi's Most Stylish' in a nationwide poll conducted by Hindustan Times. She is being listed amongst the 50 most important people of the country and counted amongst the Top 15 Women of India. Tag Heuer endorsed her as their 'Link Lady of India'.

Ms. Beri was widely recognized as one of the most prominent designers internationally and her designs were dawned by the likes of Bill Clinton, Nicole Kidman, Prince Charles and Ivana Trump. India's former Prime Minister, Dr. Manmohan Singh also acknowledged her as the progeny of that era, recognizing her as a paradigm of change.

member.name: Shri Ashok Vishwasrao Chowgule
member.content:
Mr. Ashok Vishwasrao Chowgule completed his BSc in Economic and Statistic from Bristol University in England and Business Studies from Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland, USA.

Presently, Mr. Chowgule is the Joint Managing Director of Chowgule and Co. Pvt Ltd and is in charge of the shipbuilding activity of the Chowgule group.

Mr. Chowgule was the first to introduce "block construction” process as against the traditional shipbuilding practice in Goa's ship construction.

He upgraded the infrastructure facilities at Loutulim and Rassaim Shipyards equivalent to state of the art Shipyards in Western Europe and introduced construction with duly blasted, primed, cut, bent plates and pipes having "no greens” using in-house CNC machines.

In 2014, Chowgule built two 106 TEU Container Vessels to operate between Goa-JNPT-Pipavav routes. These are the first RSV IV Vessels built in India purely for coastal trade.

member.name: Dr. Bindeshwar Pathak
member.content:
Dr. Bindeshwar Pathak had completed both PhD and D.Litt from Patna University, Bihar. His PhD Thesis was on the "Liberation of Scavengers through Low cost Sanitation”.

Dr. Pathak is the Founder of Sulabh Sanitation and Social Reform. He is also the founder of the Sulabh International Social Service Organisation. He is an internationally acclaimed expert on sanitation and has developed and implemented a low cost and appropriate toilet technology popularly known as Sulabh Shauchalaya System on pan-India scale.

The Sulabh Shauchalaya System has been declared as one of the Global Best Practices by UN-Habitat/UNCHS. On the request of the Kabul Municipality and the Government of India, Sulabh International Social Service Organisation has constructed five "Community Toilet Complexes” in Kabul, Afghanistan.

For his valuable contributions, he has been conferred various prestigious awards including Padma Bhushan (1991), International Saint Francis Prize (1992), Dubai International Award for Best Practices (2000), UNEP Global 500 Scroll of Honour Award, UN-Habitat Scroll of Honour Award(2000), Indira Gandhi Paryavaran Puraskar (2003), Good Corporate Citizen Award (2005) and Stockholm Water Prize (2009).

Dr. Pathak has also authored several well-received books, including "Road to Freedom”.

Apart from his low cost sanitation, his contributions are widely known in the areas of bio-energy and bio-fertiliser, liquid and solid waste management, poverty alleviation and integrated rehabilitation programme for the liberated scavengers.

member.name: Smt. Vani Rao
member.designation: Joint Secretary (FS), Ministry of Overseas Indian Affairs
member.content:
Ms. Vani Rao is a career diplomat, having joined the Indian Foreign Service in 1994. She started her career with a posting in the Embassy of India in Mexico from 1996 to 1998, as Third Secretary/Second Secretary and handled the political, cultural and information Desk.

Thereafter she served as an Under Secretary in West Europe Division in the Ministry of External Affairs, New Delhi from 1998 to 2001 handling India's relations with the UK, Ireland, Switzerland, Portugal, and the Commonwealth.

From 2002 to 2005 she was posted to the Embassy of India in Sweden as Second Secretary/First Secretary, handling Political, Education, Cultural and Consular work. From 2005 to 2008 she was on a sabbatical pursuing Master of Science in Environmental Studies in the San Jose State University in California, USA.

From 2008 to 2011 she worked as Director in the Americas Division in the Ministry of External Affairs in New Delhi handling India's relations with USA and Canada. From 2011 to 2014 Ms. Rao was posted to the Embassy of India, Israel as Deputy Chief of Mission and Head of the Commercial Wing.

In December 2014 she joined the Ministry of Overseas Indian Affairs as Joint Secretary (Financial Services) on deputation from the Ministry of External Affairs.

She has a Master of Arts degree in Political Science from the University of Hyderabad and speaks Spanish. She is married and has one daughter
